title: I'm so sick and tired of seeing people with KKK or Klu Klux Klan tags.
body:
Why is this even a problem in the community? I've seen variants of this like 5 times. You can't just not ban having "klu klux" in people's clan tags? Why aren't their harsher punishments for this type of behavior? It makes me not even want to play the game being bombarded with this type of racism.

Cmon Riot. Step it up.

replies.body:
**UPDATE**

This thread's been pretty quiet since yesterday, but I'm not seeing any self-regulation here with regard to removing the political comments. So, because of this, I am locking this thread. Political Discussions are directly against the [Universal Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/4LgZ2EwM-universal-rules), so while you may see it here, please know NOT to post things of this nature in the future. OP was calling out problematic behaviour, and the thread moved in a direction that it shouldn't have.

If you have questions, feel free to talk to us in the The [Boards Moderation Discord](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/qVlculPP-boards-moderation-discord) or the [Discuss the Boards](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board.

-Totally Not Jinx

>Alrighty then,

>While the sentiment of the original comment is genuine and heartfelt, I think it's officially time to try and clean up this thread. Overly political discussions, including those based on race, aren't allowed on the Boards according to the [Universal Rules](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/4LgZ2EwM-universal-rules), and that's what this has turned into.

>If you are well aware that your comments are over the line of being political, I suggest you remove them. I'll be back tomorrow to have a look at any progress, and clean up as necessary and possibly make a decision about locking the thread.

>**With regard to OP:** I'm well aware that referencing the KKK can be political. However, this comment is calling out negative and racist behaviour first and foremost. That's why the thread's getting some time to get back on track.

aprox 20 years ago we named ourself the Killer-Keks-Kommando, which translates roughly into cookie-crunch-commando
 (Because every damn time  we just ate cookies.. it was fun.. it was a joke) it took about 7 (2006)  years and a tournament in London where a our initials were on the Holoband (KKKo) that we noticed we need to change something about that

So in all honesty.. are they really just KKK or Ku-Klux-Klan in full?

It's different in NA, where there is historical significance to the acronym.

Compare it to people using Nazi slogans for club names, if you want something from European culture to compare it to.

Idk, while it's certainly in poor taste, I still think people are overly sensitive about it.  They're also somewhat similar to 9/11 jokes.  Sure they're kinda in poor taste, but I at least think they should still be allowed.

Especially if they're just making a pun with it, that's clearly just a (maybe a bit edgy) joke likely with no actual hateful intent.

Of course this is Riot's game so it's up to them what is and is not allowed, and I will abide by their rules.

If people are actually saying mean/hateful stuff in game of course, that should not be allowed.  I just don't think a club tag is in your face or serious enough to warrant punishment.

1. People sometimes use it like "look at my club tag" as a way around saying anything punishable in chat.

2. Also there's the problem with doing "edgy" stuff in society, you run the risk of crossing the line and being genuinely offensive.

I respect people trying to make a joke or trying to be edgy. The problem is that often it's not possible to differentiate between them and the people who are doing it to actually celebrate racist ideas.

Indeed, a lot of people just love being a rebel, it's cultural.

But there are lines that shouldn't be crossed even for that purpose. Making light of something as serious as systemic racism is simply not acceptable. Additionally, it runs the risk of muddying the water / creating too much 'noise' and creating opportunities for genuinely sinister groups to persist undetected.

>Making light of something as serious as systemic racism is simply not acceptable.

Joking about something doesn't mean you don't take it seriously. Often the seriousness is exactly what makes something funny in the first place.

>Additionally, it runs the risk of muddying the water / creating too much 'noise' and creating opportunities for genuinely sinister groups to persist undetected.

As soon as those sinister groups have even the slightest impact on anything whatsoever, they will be noticed, and action will be taken accordingly if the matter is serious enough.
As long as they don't have any impact on anything, they're completely irrelevant.

> [{quoted}](name=Ayzev,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ly8AnUJv,comment-id=0004000100000000000100000000,timestamp=2018-05-08T21:37:39.781+0000)
>
> Joking about something doesn't mean you don't take it seriously. Often the seriousness is exactly what makes something funny in the first place.

Fair enough. However taking something seriously is still possible while making jokes about it that should not be made. And jokes should not be made at peoples' expense, especially when the purpose of the game is not to bring those kinds of issues front and center. It's a game, for people to play. Nobody should be politicizing it or bringing offensive or vulgar concepts into it by using their tags or user-names.

> As soon as those sinister groups have even the slightest impact on anything whatsoever, they will be noticed, and action will be taken accordingly if the matter is serious enough.
> As long as they don't have any impact on anything, they're completely irrelevant.

A group doesn't have to make an impact in order to gain members, and once it has members then it can influence those members to do things off-platform that Riot could never detect. And even for activity on-platform, it's possible to build up an organization without making any impact at all, and then do something terrible out of nowhere.

Not thinking of any examples, this is just an analysis of how influence and impact work.

>jokes that should not be made

Who decides what jokes should be made and what shouldn't and how do they decide that?

>jokes should not be made at peoples' expense

So no dark humor should be allowed?

>It's a game, for people to play.

The purpose of that being fun, same as the purpose of jokes.

>Nobody should be politicizing it or bringing offensive or vulgar concepts into it by using their tags or user-names.

It only gets political when you try to get rid of it. Before then, you just either have a laugh or shake your head and move on.

>it's possible to build up an organization without making any impact at all, and then do something terrible out of nowhere.

So action should be taken based on speculation?

> [{quoted}](name=Ayzev,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=ly8AnUJv,comment-id=000400010000000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2018-05-08T23:42:06.573+0000)
>
> Who decides what jokes should be made and what shouldn't and how do they decide that?
> 
> So no dark humor should be allowed?
> 
> The purpose of that being fun, same as the purpose of jokes.

Jokes in an environment intended for jokes (such as a private discord with friends or a legitimate comedy performance) are fine.

Not everyone is here for jokes, especially jokes on that sort of subject matter. It's not a part of the expected experience, so people don't have the context needed to know it's a joke. It's bound to offend people because it's extremely offensive material. It will frequently offend people unless they know ahead of time that it's intended to be used as a joke. Are you unfamiliar with the importance of context and the importance of preparing your audience for a punchline?

> It only gets political when you try to get rid of it. Before then, you just either have a laugh or shake your head and move on.

racism is a social and political issue. Joking about it doesn't change that. And joking about it by pretending to be part of a scummy organization is too extreme to work except in environments where the audience is prepared and is expecting it to be a joke.

> So action should be taken based on speculation?

Don't cherry pick, you're taking pieces of my argument out of context. You did this for the whole comment.

The problem is that the representation of the organization is bad for things overall. Not only is it offensive and racist (and entirely unacceptable for reasons already outlined related to jokes and when it's safe to make extreme ones), but it is also visibility and representation for said group. If people are forced to remember it or think about it then they are reminded of a whole bunch of awful shit that they didn't queue up for a game of league to be reminded of in.

I feel like it's necessary to qualify here: the topic we're discussing here is very touchy in the USA, you're not from the USA so I think it's possible that you're talking about in EU. I'm talking about in NA, I don't care if people use K's in their tags in EU, because EU doesn't have a history that involves the K clan.

Yeah.  I mean I expect to be downvoted, this is a legitimate unpopular opinion here (unlike all those posts haha).

Maybe if they specifically use one of those words without a pun it should be punishable, but if it is just a pun, they should be able to appeal the decision. I generally prefer to believe the best in people and assume they're making a dumb joke rather than hiding racism.

Of course there are some who are legitimately being racist, which is why I now agree with you in regards to tags that are directly hateful.  I don't think there are as many racists though as others seem to think there are.

Edit: WTF I've said this same stuff multiple times and been downvoted to hell.  Now I say it's an unpopular opinion and I get upvotes?  What is this magic? {{sticker:sg-janna}}

"It's not illegal" =/= "It doesn't violate TOS". It's not illegal to call someone the n-word, or tell them they're garbage at this game, or to relentlessly tell someone to kill themselves (unless they actually do, but that's beside the point), but all of these behaviors are punishable in League of Legends. Using the clan tag "KKK" to promote bigotry directly contradicts with the section of the TOS against the usage of slurs and discriminatory language.

A KKK tag isn't racist. The KKK is, but their name is not. You simply associate it with racism. Naming yourself after them in a game as a joke doesn't mean you want black people lynched, it just means you have an immature sense of humor.
